004
005package edu.wpi.first.math.controller;
006
007import edu.wpi.first.math.MatBuilder;
008import edu.wpi.first.math.Nat;
009import edu.wpi.first.math.controller.proto.ElevatorFeedforwardProto;
010import edu.wpi.first.math.controller.struct.ElevatorFeedforwardStruct;
011import edu.wpi.first.math.system.plant.LinearSystemId;
012import edu.wpi.first.util.protobuf.ProtobufSerializable;
013import edu.wpi.first.util.struct.StructSerializable;
014
015/**
016 * A helper class that computes feedforward outputs for a simple elevator (modeled as a motor acting
017 * against the force of gravity).
018 */
019public class ElevatorFeedforward implements ProtobufSerializable, StructSerializable {
020  /** The static gain. */
021  private final double ks;
022
023  /** The gravity gain. */
024  private final double kg;
025
026  /** The velocity gain. */
027  private final double kv;
028
029  /** The acceleration gain. */
030  private final double ka;
031
032  /** ElevatorFeedforward protobuf for serialization. */
033  public static final ElevatorFeedforwardProto proto = new ElevatorFeedforwardProto();
034
035  /** ElevatorFeedforward struct for serialization. */
036  public static final ElevatorFeedforwardStruct struct = new ElevatorFeedforwardStruct();
037
038  /**
039   * Creates a new ElevatorFeedforward with the specified gains. Units of the gain values will
040   * dictate units of the computed feedforward.
041   *
042   * @param ks The static gain.
043   * @param kg The gravity gain.
044   * @param kv The velocity gain.
045   * @param ka The acceleration gain.
046   * @throws IllegalArgumentException for kv &lt; zero.
047   * @throws IllegalArgumentException for ka &lt; zero.
048   */
049  public ElevatorFeedforward(double ks, double kg, double kv, double ka) {
050    this.ks = ks;
051    this.kg = kg;
052    this.kv = kv;
053    this.ka = ka;
054    if (kv < 0.0) {
055      throw new IllegalArgumentException("kv must be a non-negative number, got " + kv + "!");
056    }
057    if (ka < 0.0) {
058      throw new IllegalArgumentException("ka must be a non-negative number, got " + ka + "!");
059    }
060  }
061
062  /**
063   * Creates a new ElevatorFeedforward with the specified gains. Acceleration gain is defaulted to
064   * zero. Units of the gain values will dictate units of the computed feedforward.
065   *
066   * @param ks The static gain.
067   * @param kg The gravity gain.
068   * @param kv The velocity gain.
069   */
070  public ElevatorFeedforward(double ks, double kg, double kv) {
071    this(ks, kg, kv, 0);
072  }
073
074  /**
075   * Returns the static gain.
076   *
077   * @return The static gain.
078   */
079  public double getKs() {
080    return ks;
081  }
082
083  /**
084   * Returns the gravity gain.
085   *
086   * @return The gravity gain.
087   */
088  public double getKg() {
089    return kg;
090  }
091
092  /**
093   * Returns the velocity gain.
094   *
095   * @return The velocity gain.
096   */
097  public double getKv() {
098    return kv;
099  }
100
101  /**
102   * Returns the acceleration gain.
103   *
104   * @return The acceleration gain.
105   */
106  public double getKa() {
107    return ka;
108  }
109
110  /**
111   * Calculates the feedforward from the gains and setpoints.
112   *
113   * @param velocity The velocity setpoint.
114   * @param acceleration The acceleration setpoint.
115   * @return The computed feedforward.
116   */
117  public double calculate(double velocity, double acceleration) {
118    return ks * Math.signum(velocity) + kg + kv * velocity + ka * acceleration;
119  }
120
121  /**
122   * Calculates the feedforward from the gains and setpoints.
123   *
124   * <p>Note this method is inaccurate when the velocity crosses 0.
125   *
126   * @param currentVelocity The current velocity setpoint.
127   * @param nextVelocity The next velocity setpoint.
128   * @param dtSeconds Time between velocity setpoints in seconds.
129   * @return The computed feedforward.
130   */
131  public double calculate(double currentVelocity, double nextVelocity, double dtSeconds) {
132    // Discretize the affine model.
133    //
134    //   dx/dt = Ax + Bu + c
135    //   dx/dt = Ax + B(u + B⁺c)
136    //   xₖ₊₁ = eᴬᵀxₖ + A⁻¹(eᴬᵀ - I)B(uₖ + B⁺cₖ)
137    //   xₖ₊₁ = A_d xₖ + B_d (uₖ + B⁺cₖ)
138    //   xₖ₊₁ = A_d xₖ + B_duₖ + B_d B⁺cₖ
139    //
140    // Solve for uₖ.
141    //
142    //   B_duₖ = xₖ₊₁ − A_d xₖ − B_d B⁺cₖ
143    //   uₖ = B_d⁺(xₖ₊₁ − A_d xₖ − B_d B⁺cₖ)
144    //   uₖ = B_d⁺(xₖ₊₁ − A_d xₖ) − B⁺cₖ
145    //
146    // For an elevator with the model
147    // dx/dt = -Kv/Ka x + 1/Ka u - Kg/Ka - Ks/Ka sgn(x),
148    // A = -Kv/Ka, B = 1/Ka, and c = -(Kg/Ka + Ks/Ka sgn(x)). Substitute in B
149    // assuming sgn(x) is a constant for the duration of the step.
150    //
151    //   uₖ = B_d⁺(xₖ₊₁ − A_d xₖ) − Ka(-(Kg/Ka + Ks/Ka sgn(x)))
152    //   uₖ = B_d⁺(xₖ₊₁ − A_d xₖ) + Ka(Kg/Ka + Ks/Ka sgn(x))
153    //   uₖ = B_d⁺(xₖ₊₁ − A_d xₖ) + Kg + Ks sgn(x)
154    var plant = LinearSystemId.identifyVelocitySystem(this.kv, this.ka);
155    var feedforward = new LinearPlantInversionFeedforward<>(plant, dtSeconds);
156
157    var r = MatBuilder.fill(Nat.N1(), Nat.N1(), currentVelocity);
158    var nextR = MatBuilder.fill(Nat.N1(), Nat.N1(), nextVelocity);
159
160    return kg + ks * Math.signum(currentVelocity) + feedforward.calculate(r, nextR).get(0, 0);
161  }
162
163  /**
164   * Calculates the feedforward from the gains and velocity setpoint (acceleration is assumed to be
165   * zero).
166   *
167   * @param velocity The velocity setpoint.
168   * @return The computed feedforward.
169   */
170  public double calculate(double velocity) {
171    return calculate(velocity, 0);
172  }
173
174  // Rearranging the main equation from the calculate() method yields the
175  // formulas for the methods below:
176
177  /**
178   * Calculates the maximum achievable velocity given a maximum voltage supply and an acceleration.
179   * Useful for ensuring that velocity and acceleration constraints for a trapezoidal profile are
180   * simultaneously achievable - enter the acceleration constraint, and this will give you a
181   * simultaneously-achievable velocity constraint.
182   *
183   * @param maxVoltage The maximum voltage that can be supplied to the elevator.
184   * @param acceleration The acceleration of the elevator.
185   * @return The maximum possible velocity at the given acceleration.
186   */
187  public double maxAchievableVelocity(double maxVoltage, double acceleration) {
188    // Assume max velocity is positive
189    return (maxVoltage - ks - kg - acceleration * ka) / kv;
190  }
191
192  /**
193   * Calculates the minimum achievable velocity given a maximum voltage supply and an acceleration.
194   * Useful for ensuring that velocity and acceleration constraints for a trapezoidal profile are
195   * simultaneously achievable - enter the acceleration constraint, and this will give you a
196   * simultaneously-achievable velocity constraint.
197   *
198   * @param maxVoltage The maximum voltage that can be supplied to the elevator.
199   * @param acceleration The acceleration of the elevator.
200   * @return The minimum possible velocity at the given acceleration.
201   */
202  public double minAchievableVelocity(double maxVoltage, double acceleration) {
203    // Assume min velocity is negative, ks flips sign
204    return (-maxVoltage + ks - kg - acceleration * ka) / kv;
205  }
206
207  /**
208   * Calculates the maximum achievable acceleration given a maximum voltage supply and a velocity.
209   * Useful for ensuring that velocity and acceleration constraints for a trapezoidal profile are
210   * simultaneously achievable - enter the velocity constraint, and this will give you a
211   * simultaneously-achievable acceleration constraint.
212   *
213   * @param maxVoltage The maximum voltage that can be supplied to the elevator.
214   * @param velocity The velocity of the elevator.
215   * @return The maximum possible acceleration at the given velocity.
216   */
217  public double maxAchievableAcceleration(double maxVoltage, double velocity) {
218    return (maxVoltage - ks * Math.signum(velocity) - kg - velocity * kv) / ka;
219  }
220
221  /**
222   * Calculates the minimum achievable acceleration given a maximum voltage supply and a velocity.
223   * Useful for ensuring that velocity and acceleration constraints for a trapezoidal profile are
224   * simultaneously achievable - enter the velocity constraint, and this will give you a
225   * simultaneously-achievable acceleration constraint.
226   *
227   * @param maxVoltage The maximum voltage that can be supplied to the elevator.
228   * @param velocity The velocity of the elevator.
229   * @return The minimum possible acceleration at the given velocity.
230   */
231  public double minAchievableAcceleration(double maxVoltage, double velocity) {
232    return maxAchievableAcceleration(-maxVoltage, velocity);
233  }
234}
